You should never directly invoke this method. Instead, access the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindowController/window] property so the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindowController/windowDidLoad()] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindowController/windowWillLoad()] methods are invoked. Subclasses can override this method if the way it finds and loads the window is not adequate. It then locates the nib file within the bundle and, if successful, loads it; if unsuccessful, it tries to find the nib file in the main bundle.

# loadWindow()

**Instance Method**

Loads the receiver’s window from the nib file.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func loadWindow()
```

## Discussion

You should never directly invoke this method. Instead, access the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindowController/window] property so the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindowController/windowDidLoad()] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSWindowController/windowWillLoad()] methods are invoked. Subclasses can override this method if the way it finds and loads the window is not adequate. It uses the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/Bundle] class’s [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/Bundle/init(for:)] method to get the bundle, using the class of the nib file owner as argument. It then locates the nib file within the bundle and, if successful, loads it; if unsuccessful, it tries to find the nib file in the main bundle.

## Loading and Displaying the Window

- **showWindow(_:)**: Displays the window associated with the receiver.
- **isWindowLoaded**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the nib file containing the receiver’s window has been loaded.
- **window**: The window owned by the receiver.
- **windowDidLoad()**: Sent after the window owned by the receiver has been loaded.
- **windowWillLoad()**: Sent before the window owned by the receiver is loaded.
